column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Pinocchio runs the danger of being fried in a pan like a fish
#Text=During that wild chase , Pinocchio lived through a terrible moment when he almost gave himself up as lost .
#Text=This was when Alidoro ( that was the Mastiff ’s name ) , in a frenzy of running , came so near that he was on the very point of reaching him .
#Text=The Marionette heard , close behind him , the labored breathing of the beast who was fast on his trail , and now and again even felt his hot breath blow over him .
#Text=Luckily , by this time , he was very near the shore , and the sea was in sight ; in fact , only a few short steps away .
#Text=As soon as he set foot on the beach , Pinocchio gave a leap and fell into the water .
#Text=Alidoro tried to stop , but as he was running very fast , he could n’t , and he , too , landed far out in the sea .
#Text=Strange though it may seem , the Dog could not swim .
#Text=He beat the water with his paws to hold himself up , but the harder he tried , the deeper he sank .
#Text=As he stuck his head out once more , the poor fellow ’s eyes were bulging and he barked out wildly , “ I drown ! I drown ! ”
#Text=“ Drown ! ” answered Pinocchio from afar , happy at his escape .
#Text=“ Help , Pinocchio , dear little Pinocchio !
#Text=Save me from death ! ”
#Text=At those cries of suffering , the Marionette , who after all had a very kind heart , was moved to compassion .
#Text=He turned toward the poor animal and said to him :
#Text=“ But if I help you , will you promise not to bother me again by running after me ? ”
#Text=“ I promise ! I promise !
#Text=Only hurry , for if you wait another second , I ’ll be dead and gone ! ”
#Text=Pinocchio hesitated still another minute .
#Text=Then , remembering how his father had often told him that a kind deed is never lost , he swam to Alidoro and , catching hold of his tail , dragged him to the shore .
#Text=The poor Dog was so weak he could not stand .
#Text=He had swallowed so much salt water that he was swollen like a balloon .
#Text=However , Pinocchio , not wishing to trust him too much , threw himself once again into the sea .
#Text=As he swam away , he called out :
#Text=“ Good-by , Alidoro , good luck and remember me to the family ! ”
#Text=“ Good-by , little Pinocchio , ” answered the Dog . “ A thousand thanks for having saved me from death .
#Text=You did me a good turn , and , in this world , what is given is always returned .
#Text=If the chance comes , I shall be there . ”
#Text=Pinocchio went on swimming close to shore .
#Text=At last he thought he had reached a safe place .
#Text=Glancing up and down the beach , he saw the opening of a cave out of which rose a spiral of smoke .
#Text=“ In that cave , ” he said to himself , “ there must be a fire .
#Text=So much the better .
#Text=I ’ll dry my clothes and warm myself , and then -- well -- ”
#Text=His mind made up , Pinocchio swam to the rocks , but as he started to climb , he felt something under him lifting him up higher and higher .
#Text=He tried to escape , but he was too late .
#Text=To his great surprise , he found himself in a huge net , amid a crowd of fish of all kinds and sizes , who were fighting and struggling desperately to free themselves .
#Text=At the same time , he saw a Fisherman come out of the cave , a Fisherman so ugly that Pinocchio thought he was a sea monster .
#Text=In place of hair , his head was covered by a thick bush of green grass .
#Text=Green was the skin of his body , green were his eyes , green was the long , long beard that reached down to his feet .
#Text=He looked like a giant lizard with legs and arms .
#Text=When the Fisherman pulled the net out of the sea , he cried out joyfully :
#Text=“ Blessed Providence !
#Text=Once more I ’ll have a fine meal of fish ! ”
#Text=“ Thank Heaven , I ’m not a fish ! ” said Pinocchio to himself , trying with these words to find a little courage .
#Text=The Fisherman took the net and the fish to the cave , a dark , gloomy , smoky place .
#Text=In the middle of it , a pan full of oil sizzled over a smoky fire , sending out a repelling odor of tallow that took away one ’s breath .
#Text=“ Now , let ’s see what kind of fish we have caught today , ” said the Green Fisherman .
#Text=He put a hand as big as a spade into the net and pulled out a handful of mullets .
#Text=“ Fine mullets , these ! ” he said , after looking at them and smelling them with pleasure .
#Text=After that , he threw them into a large , empty tub .
#Text=Many times he repeated this performance .
#Text=As he pulled each fish out of the net , his mouth watered with the thought of the good dinner coming , and he said :
#Text=“ Fine fish , these bass ! ”
#Text=“ Very tasty , these whitefish ! ”
#Text=“ Delicious flounders , these ! ”
#Text=“ What splendid crabs ! ”
#Text=“ And these dear little anchovies , with their heads still on ! ”
#Text=As you can well imagine , the bass , the flounders , the whitefish , and even the little anchovies all went together into the tub to keep the mullets company .
#Text=The last to come out of the net was Pinocchio .
#Text=As soon as the Fisherman pulled him out , his green eyes opened wide with surprise , and he cried out in fear :
#Text=“ What kind of fish is this ? I do n’t remember ever eating anything like it . ”
